newsitem.title: USA: ADR REPORT - Telebras up in ADR trade.
newsitem.headline: ADR REPORT - Telebras up in ADR trade.

text.p: Brazilian telecommunications holding Telebras rose to a 12-month high by late morning on Thursday.
The state-run company's American Depositary Receipts were up 1/4 to 85-1/8 in moderate trade. The previous year's high wa 85-1/8.
Traders said Telebras was boosted by prospects for privatization of the state telephone system and signs the Brazilian government might free foreign investors from a new financial transactions tax.
"The market has been subject to rumors about the new (tax) in Brazil," a trader said.
Telebras and other Latin American stocks also have been pushed higher since the start of the year by an influx of new money seeking Latin investments.

Among other regional bellwether stocks, Telefonos de Mexico was unchanged at 39, close to a 12-month high. Shares were trading in moderate volume of 1.2 million shares at mid-morning but were still among most-active stocks on the New York Stock Exchange.
Israel's Scitex Corp Ltd was up 1-1/4 to 12-1/8 in heavy volume amid rumors Eastman Kodak Co would buy International Paper Co's stake in the company.

International Paper said on Wednesday it would take a $165 million pre-tax charge to write down its investment in Scitex, a maker of visual information products. A Kodak spokesman said company policy was not to comment on rumors.

Franco-Italian semiconductor maker SGS-Thomson Microelectronics NV rose 2-3/4 to 79-3/8 after Paris' Le Monde newspaper reported the French government would open the company's capital to new industrial partners.
Shares in Dutch software company Baan Co NV were up 1-1/2 to 45-5/8.
Advancers led declining stocks by a margin of 313 to 162 among 807 ADRs. Volume was 31.2 million shares.
